info.game_comments: (Capt. Warner: I'm Captain Bernhard Warner.  The Clue Crew joins me onboard Golden Princess--next on Jeopardy!)

(1, 1).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew on the Golden Princess.)  I'm on this deck, whose name is from French for "walk" or "stroll."

(2, 1).clue: This Russian city's mayor Yuri Luzhkov has launched many construction projects to revitalize the city

(3, 1).clue: This common home appliance has a tumble setting

(4, 1).clue: Its May 18, 2000 episode in which Daphne left Donny at the altar for Niles was its highest-rated to that date

(5, 1).clue: Mexico City's Olympic Stadium was built to resemble the crater of one of these

(6, 1).clue: When conditions are reversed, this is "on the other foot"

(1, 2).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew on the Golden Princess.)  It's okay to gamble once the ship is at least this far from the U.S.

(2, 2).clue: (Hi, I'm Rudy Giuliani.) I'm at the desk of one of my heroes -- this "Little Flower," who was mayor of New York City from 1934 to 1945.

(3, 2).clue: Nursery rhyme line following, "Jack fell down and broke his crown"

(4, 2).clue: In this series' first episode Michael Flaherty grappled with a garbage strike & a political gaffe by the mayor

(5, 2).clue: The pyramids named for these 2 heavenly bodies stand within Teotihuacan

(6, 2).clue: To economize is to tighten this accessory

(1, 3).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew on the Golden Princess.)   It's the name of an ancient type of ship, or of the kitchen of a modern vessel.

(2, 3).clue: Nobel Peace Prize winner Willy Brandt was mayor of this beleaguered city from 1957 to 1966

(3, 3).clue: Janet McTeer was a Best Actress Oscar nominee for her role in this 1999 film

(4, 3).clue: In 1998 Garry Shandling & Peter Tolan won Emmys for writing the "Flip" episode of this HBO sitcom

(5, 3).clue: Villahermosa in this "saucy" state was a major center for the Olmecs

(6, 3).clue: In "The Tenant of Wildfell Hall", Anne Bronte wrote, "He ought not to be tied to his mother's" these

(1, 4).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew on the Golden Princess.)   The captain and I are traveling 23 statute miles per hour, which is 20 of these.

(2, 4).clue: Willie Brown, Speaker of the California Assembly for 15 years, is now mayor of this city

(3, 4).clue: Add 4 letters to "tumble" to get this word that means dilapidated

(4, 4).clue: This "Happy Days" producer & film director played the network president on "Murphy Brown"

(6, 4).clue: This 2-word phrase for a pompous bore may come from retailers putting tissue inside of clothing items on display

(1, 5).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew on the Golden Princess.)  This term for the area where I'm standing originally meant the central court of a roman house.

(2, 5).clue: Before he became president in 1995, he had been the mayor of Paris for nearly 20 years

(3, 5).clue: This "& tumble" refers to haphazard struggling

(4, 5).clue: In "It May Look Like a Walnut", an episode of this sitcom, Rob dreams about an alien who looks like Danny Thomas

(6, 5).clue: One who becomes successful through his own efforts pulls himself up by these

(1, 1).clue: German is the official language of Germany; Arabic & this European one are the official languages of Chad

(4, 1).clue: Spanish for "father", it's a military chaplain or a San Diego Major League ballplayer

(5, 1).clue: There are no locks in the auditory & semicircular ones of these

(6, 1).clue: He finished his "Idylls of the King" the year after he was made a baron

(1, 2).clue: Of 200, 2,000 or 12,000, the approximate miles you would have to fly to get from Chad to Germany

(3, 2).clue: According to the TV opening, it's one of the things Superman fights for

(4, 2).clue: (Hi, I'm Alan Dershowitz.) This title of a book of mine is a Yiddish term for nerve or effrontery

(5, 2).clue: This term for the flap of cartilage that forms the outer ear sounds like a Delphi diviner

(6, 2).clue: Henry V onscreen in 1946, he was made a life peer in 1970

(1, 3).clue: 2 percent of Germans & 50 percent of Chadians are members of this religion

(3, 3).clue: (Hi, I'm Mackenzie Phillips.)  I hung around Mel's Drive-In as part of the cast of this classic 1973 film

(4, 3).clue: In Italian it means "Do you understand?"

(5, 3).clue: A valve in the heart is named for the same Italian anatomist as this tube in the ear

(1, 4).clue: In Chad this demographic benchmark is 49; in Germany, 77

(3, 4).clue: In 1969 the House Committee on these became the Committee on Internal Security

(4, 4).clue: In Arabic it's an expert in the law; in English it means "civilian clothing"

(5, 4).clue: The utriculus & sacculus are your chief organs of orientation & this

(1, 5).clue: General Idriss Deby is the president of Chad; this man is the chancellor of Germany

(3, 5).clue: Title of the 1837 Emerson oration re-delivered here Listen.

(4, 5).clue: It follows "lumpen" in a 17-letter German Marxist term for a low class of beggars & the like

(0, 0).clue: Federal Express founder Fred Smith made a special cameo appearance in this 2000 film
